contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Yamagawa'''|山川町|Yamagawa-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ibusuki District, Kagoshima|Ibusuki District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On January 1, 2006 Yamagawa, along with the town of [[Kaimon, Kagoshima|Kaimon]], also from [[Ibusuki District, Kagoshima|Ibusuki District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Ibusuki, Kagoshima|Ibusuki]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 10,467 and the [[population density|density]] of 281.52 persons per km². The total area was 37.18 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.ibusuki.kagoshima.jp/ Official website of Ibusuki] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
